title: supportive staff
body:
doctors will listen to your problems 
when appointment available will offer
need more receptions to cover fone calls

title: Great service
body:
I must recommend the pharmacist who attended me on two occasions. I went there last week with a chest infection, an x-ray was proposed which I had and of course medications which had been changed by the pharmacist. I was delighted with the outcome of using the new inhalers and haven't felt this well in a long time. I also felt that he really listened to me and was easy and comfortable to voice my concerns to him 
without feeling that you were wasting or taking up all of their time. Everything was explained to me. He also advised me to use the prescription prepayment scheme which I found easy to do online. So, if you can't see a GP I would definitely recommend seeing the pharmacist at the surgery, he also booked the second appointment for me while I was with him so I didn't have to go through the rigmarole myself

title: Excellent service
body: Woke up with pains in back and chest yesterday morning. Decided to get medical opinion and was in surgery at 09.30 and was given an appointment with a Partner 25 minutes later. Full examination followed by referral to Ambulatory Assessment Unit at the JR. Whilst waiting I found the new informatics in the reception area extremely useful with live information on clinicians and locations, and on separate screens useful information on self help care.

title: Straightforward and helpful
body: I needed to visit the surgery urgently yesterday and despite not phoning until 9am, the reception staff found me a hub appointment and everything needed was sorted out by the Dr I saw at Courtyard (Hub Dr.).  I know the pressures Primary Care are under and although the best outcome would have been seeing my own Dr, I was just so grateful to be seen by someone who was able to support me yesterday which was really what I needed most.  Thank you.

title: Precription omitted medication and appointment
body:
Last prescription was 19th November. Put releat prescription in week before Christmas. On collection the main medication was omitted was  informed the surgery didn't put it on prescription.  Booked blood test for 13th unable to get meds review booked told to call for appt. 
 Now down to last week of medication and can't get appt until 29th Jan. Told to call again. Can a review not be done over phone ?? I was also informed to see my GP by A pharmacist I asked for advice regarding another ongoing matter which needs addressing.

author: Cyclic
title: Treatment at Aberdeen ED.
body: Managed to dislocate my shoulder slipping down a bank into the river Don. Everyone at Aberdeen ARI ED was superb, from the receptionist who very kindly got me a wheelchair (I think she could see me shaking) to the consultant, radiographers, and nurses. The department was very busy but I was seen after about 20 mins of waiting and was made to feel that I was being treated by a very professional team. I was in considerable pain but never did I feel that I was being a nuisance. Thank you to everyone in the ED, you are a credit to the NHS.

title: Excellent service throughout 16820
body: Excellent service throughout. Very caring people who talked with me. Thorough eye test, treatment, appointments.

title: Very poor
body: My husband is in severe pain can not walk we came in December was told operation early January we saw the consultant he said early January got a letter to come for another pre op 7th January even though he had one in November when we got there was told we did not need to come so for a 74 year olds going there up at 5 30 because we had to get hospital transport from Wigan then the spinal team as said early February it is a joke they keep moving the goal posts very disappointed with the treatment so far they even put urgent on the surgery letter but that must be a joke keep sending wrong information it is a disgrace from this hospital he has 3 holes in is spine a collapsing coccya  and fractured vertebrae not good given up

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Bad service- CAN NOT get appointment
body:
You have to ring I the day for an appointment. Usually, after about 20 mins when you get through, all appointments have gone.  There are never any available online either. 
When you do get through, you have to discuss you problem with them receptionist who then makes you an appointment with a nurse!!! 
Saw a rude nurse today, she was very impatient and snappy! Can’t ever get an appointment.  Surgery seems way too stretched! 

Looking to move practice

title: Telephone discussion request with g.p.
body:
I have been off work for the week with d&v.  I have not eaten anything since Monday lunch.
I have type 2 diabetes and was concerned about how much insulin to take.
I called the surgery on Thursday afternoon and asked the receptionist if I could book a telephone consultation with the g.p. I was also concerned that by Thursday My symptoms Had not improved since Monday.

After the receptionist asked my name, she stated that I should have called earlier. She asked for my telephone number. I asked for the name of the g.p. 

I waited until 7.00pm but received no call.  
D&V is debilitating. No way could I visit the surgery.  After four days I needed some medication.
Diabetes is a serious condition.  I would have asked how much insulin to take.

Five minutes of the g.p's time - is this too much to ask.  Maybe the g.p. Did not get the message!

title: Excellent Care
body: Had appointment for routine blood pressure check and ECG.When ECG carried out an abnormality was noticed immediately by the nurse who referred straight away to a doctor- 30 mins later was in A & E Dept for tests resulting in comprehensive care for several days. Very grateful for the attention and professionalism of all concerned.

author: Torrie
title: Heart failure and resuscitation
body:
Early one October morning, having suffered a heart attack, I was resuscitated at home by paramedics and then taken by ambulance to QEUH and had to be resuscitated again in the ambulance on the way there. My only memory of that journey was of a female paramedic’s excited reaction at having “brought me back”. I was her first- she sounded so delighted.  
On the operating table in the Jubilee Hospital I was once more shocked back to life then had 2/3 stents inserted into my 35 year old triple bypass ( done at the Western Infirmary). I owe my life to these dedicated workers. Within a week I was up and about and home, due to an “exceptional recovery” from what “not many survive”. Thanks to all staff, ambulance drivers, paramedics, doctors, nurses, auxiliaries, surgeons etc.  
This wonderful NHS of ours requires active participation by both staff and patients. We all have our part to play, many find fault, complain and abuse the system. It may not be perfect but it is extremely effective! We are very fortunate to have it and must protect it.

title: Very helpful and friendly staff
body:
I have been with this surgery for many years now, the receptionists are second no none, you can always get a same day appointment when you ring early enough, this may be with a nurse but she can give prescriptions and is very thorough.  All of the GPs are very nice, as you will see im a regular attender with long term conditions and have nothing bad to say about this fantastic team.  

You are serving your patients well.  Pat on the back to everyome at Croft Surgey

title: Thank you A&E,SAU, & Surgical Team
body:
Twice this week I have been to A&E. First visit I was in and out within 90 minutes, and I received excellent advice and attention with advice as to what to do if things do not improve. I came as more of a walk in patient as the surgery was closed on Saturday.
I went back on Wednesday as instructed as there was no change. I waited about two hours but once seen I was given blood tests cannula and everything I needed. I left just over three hours after arrival with an appointment for 7am yesterday to come to SAU for surgery.
On arrival the night staff were still in situ and the waiting room was empty. I was advised that the surgery originally booked for 8am would be slightly delayed but was kept informed all along the way. The night sister came and personally wished me good luck today using my first name as she left for the day. I have worked nights and yours are long, that was so appreciated, kind,she didn't have to do that but she did and it instilled confidence that everyone knew what was going on. 
I received excellent attention from the day staff, was prepared well, by the nursing staff, anaesthetist,porter who wheeled me to surgery.
It was a small op only 30 minutes asleep and in recovery all of the staff were so kind and attentive. By 11.30 I had been taken back to the surgical unit from theatre. Had enjoyed a sandwich and a coffee, and they had called my husband to collect me. 
Discharge papers were ready and extra interim dressings etc. I was in the car on the way home before noon.
I can be quick to complain and generally I do not suffer fools gladly but please believe me when I say the service, care and kindness I experience was exemplary. Thank you so much. Thank you A&E. Thank you SAU. Thank you to the anaesthetist . Thank you to the consultant, for your easy way despite the heavy load I gave you. Thank you theatre staff and recovery staff and everyone on the surgical unit first floor. Each and every one of you were excellent. 
The NHS are fantastic, a resource that cannot be underestimated in terms of value to all. We are all so lucky to have this.So many good people.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent Practise
body:
Because of a condition I have, I have to carry with me a box containing Medication, a Syringe and some Needles.  I hadn't realised until very recently that needles go out of date. I spoke to the Reception Staff at the Surgery but this was a situation they had never had to dealing with. They decide to defer the issue to the Practise Nurse. Unfortunately she was not available at that precise moment. They offered to either ring me when they had had chance to talk to the Nurse or set up an appointment for me. I went for first option.
I left the Surgery heading for the nearest Bus Stop. Within 10 minutes they rang me back saying everything was sorted out. Both parties learnt something that day.
So 25 minutes after first arriving at the Surgery, I left a satisfied Customer.

author: Twaddle
title: Excellent care
body: I attended day surgery just before Christmas and was very well looked after by Dr Milling-Smith and the teams from Day Surgery and Theatre. Thank you very much. There were so many little touches that made the experience a good one. Kindness well demonstrated. This continued yesterday when I attended for an ultrasound in Stirling Community Hospital and MRI at Forth Valley Royal Hospital. Kindness accompanied by professional competence. So grateful. I have worked with the NHS for 40+ years and I am still humbled by what our multidisciplinary teams do on a daily basis. ❤️NHS.

title: Unacceptable practice
body: My mother was taken to the cdu on 6.1. 2020 by ambulance after having a funny turn. She was left along with lots of other patients in corridors on a trolley bed for 18 hours. We accept there was a shortage of beds but nobody offered my mom a drink or anything to eat during all these hours and this we find totally unacceptable. Also nobody kept us informed of what was happening at all. There seemed to be a total lack of communication. Also when she actually moved into a proper ward she had not even been given her usual medications which were strong pain relief and anxiety tablets although we had said that she needs them. This is also unacceptable. We were told that the staff could not administer them as they had not been prescribed by the hospital. This is so wrong as our mom was in severe pain and very anxious and really needed her medication. This was eventually sorted out but why should she have had to suffer the pain and anxiety for so long I even offered to administer them myself but was told I couldn't. Just seems so wrong to let someone suffer so much when there was no need. The medication was prescribed by our moms own gp after all. Just seems so senseless.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: The NHS at its best
body:
Reading previous reviews which focus on phone answering, waiting, etc  I hear what you say but when it matters, this practice are superb. Life isn’t transactional and if previous patients appts have overrun as it has taken longer than expected, isn’t that okay? 

I went through what was a very scary time for me and I couldn’t have asked for a better doctor and practice to be with. Thank you.

author: Sdc001
title: Day Surgery unit
body:
I was admitted beginning of the year for a small Hernia repair, under the consultation of Mr. Wadhawan. From start to finish his team from, the lady on reception to the surgical staff that did the repair were all excellent. The people that keep these small but important day care units running smoothly are a godsend to this small but important service. Lastly a big thank you to my aftercare throughout the day from the Nurses on the daycare ward, their care was excellent.  
Hopefully this praise will reach these professionals, they deserve it.  
Thank you

title: Still waiting for an appointment
body: Having spent 5 hours in the waiting room, I was eventually seen by a doctor who advised that I had a torn and detached retina that would be treated urgently within 3-4 days. Not counting the weekend, I have waited 3 days and haven’t yet received an an appointment. You read on line how serious this is as it can lead to blindness if not treated quickly. Very worried.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Appauling waiting times
body:
Sadly I have no option but to use the Colliery or Tickhill Surgeries.
Although I live near the Colliery, I can NEVER get an appointment, either online or by phone.
I try to never use a GP for this reason.
When I do I always get referred to use Tickhill Surgery,  where I've always experienced a average waiting time of 30mins. However start of a New Year,  and despite arriving 5mins before my appointment, I still ended up waiting for over 70min!! To be told I should be resting in bed?!! Well Doctor, I would rather have been there, than travelling to the surgery away from home, and being made to wait over an hour for a 5min appointment. 
The time management and appointment of both surgeries is appauling.
These need to be held to account as this is ridiculous. You wonder why appointments get missed? Not everyone will sit for over an hour in pain, and the surgery is failing it's patients.
Maybe if the NHS worked on a paid per patient system, the GPs might arrive at the surgery on time, as is expected of patients, and also, stick to the allocated appointment time limits.
How can a surgery that opens 9am, by 10am, already be behind 25min, then increasing to an hour??
Before GPs demand wage rises, maybe they should be lower paid in reflection of their performance. 
Because these two surgeries are not performing to the public, and it's been like this for 15yr at least.
Appauling

title: Residential Care Home
body: We are a Residential Care Home which the practice visits, we have a great relationship with all at the practice. All of the GP's are supportive to us, considerate and caring to the residents, never making them feel like they are wasting their time. The receptionists are helpful and efficient with requests, they also phone back when they say they are going to. We are very comfortable contacting the GP's for advice and appreciate that they treat us as partners.

author: PrettyFlower90
title: compassionate, friendly and supportive staff
body:
I just wanted to give some positive feedback regarding the care I received recently with the birth of my son.  
From the moment we arrived in triage to discharge, we were made to feel so cared for. I want to especially thank the midwives who looked after me during my extremely long labour. Rebecca was with me from the start and she was so friendly and supportive. She was never intrusive and helped support my husband as well. At the later stages of my labour Jackie was absolutely outstanding, and I could not have gone through it without her. She made sure my birth plan was followed as much as possible and wanted me to be as comfortable as possible. I ended up with a traumatic birth that was far from my plan. It was Jackie that supported me entirely through it, even though I was hysterical. She is a credit to the AMU and midwifery profession.  
My son ended up briefly in the neonatal unit, and the staff we encountered every day were so compassionate, supportive and friendly. It was an extremely tough time for us as a new family, but they all made sure we were supported as much as possible.  
I cannot thank all the staff enough, and maternity services should be proud of their staff.

title: Superb treatment by students
body: After not visiting a dentist for 52 years due to terrible experience I visited the dental hospital very scared. I have now been on numerous occasions and have been treated superbly by students and teaching staff. I have had roots extracted, teeth extracted, fillings and numerous other treatments. Everyone understood how I felt and treated me with great respect and care. I cannot thank your students enough.

title: Brilliant
body: I find the diabetes Dept absolutely brilliant, most of my visits I am treated with respect and the staff are helpful. On a couple of occasions it seems there is lack of communication between the staff who do the blood pressure & weighing as on 2 occasions I have not been called to have this done, but I wouldn’t call this a problem. The diabetes team are amazing and can not fault them

title: Lacking in compassion
body:
I had a horrible experience with Deptford Surgery.  Myself and my partner can never get an appointment and being told to call again the next day or go to the walk in centre. 

I was really unwell at one point and needed to see a doctor but could not get an appointment and was told to visit the Waldron centre walk in. This was incredibly difficult as I was extremely fatigued, ill and having to wait for the walk in appointment felt like an eternity. It was then I came out in a rash, along with a sore neck I thought I had meningitis. I was not seen promptly and was told to wait by the receptionist due to the large amount of people wanting to be seen. 

In the end in a state of panic and feeling severely unwell I ended up leaving and calling an ambulance on myself. This I felt so awful for but felt I had no other choice. I then got to Kings College and was diagnosed with a viral infection that spread to my face and lower body and remained there for the duration of two weeks.  

I work for the NHS for 10 years and being treated like this really disappointed me as I felt there was no compassion, organisation and lack of empathy for each patient. 
I work for Guy’s and St Thomas Hospital and I couldn’t quite believe that the staff at Deptford surgery/Waldron centre could not assess or help and attend to people who say and look acutely unwell. 

Will be leaving Deptford Surgery and hoping to join another with hopefully more professional staff.

title: Great practice
body:
Had to visit with my son who had broken his little finger.
Staff were feb. So friendly and efficient- nothing was too much trouble. In and out within an hour and ten mins and that included an xray. Amazing service - Thank you all for your hard work

title: The gp’s attitude to treating people is very…
body: I booked the appointment with gp for my 1 year old child who suffers with finger infection. Our appointment was the first one for our doctor as we saw her arriving to work. We all arrived earlier so I hoped doctor will see us on time. Unfortunately she saw us minimum 5mins later than scheduled appointment. She examined the finger within 10 sec and prescribed the ointment (everything took her 2 mins). As my other daughter was not well I asked the doctor to check her throat and chest. GP seemed very upset I asked her to do it but started checking my daughters throat. As she did not open it wide enough the gp decided to take the spoon to open it wider. Suddenly she changed her mind and started saying that she shouldn’t be doing it and I should book another appointment. I said that it is impossible to get double appointment and I asked her only to check so it doesn’t take that long. She started complaining that “I will have to treat her if I find something”. This attitude made me worried about NHS doctors who prefer not to find anything in case they need to treat the patient! In the end she did not check my daughters throat because her rude complains upset my daughter and she started crying. When I was leaving the doctor started educating me about 111 nhs service which I told her that works only in theory and patients are told to go to the nearest emergency department. I must admit that every time I see her she is not nice and grumpy. My daughter will not want to see any gp any more after this woman who has no empathy for children so not even mentioning the adults. I get an impression that gps in the practices use the nhs crisis to complain for no reason as their work can not be compared to doctors’ in hospitals and other nhs jobs.

title: They service only when they feel like it
body:
Had an emergency where I couldn't move my arm. went there in person to see if a nurse or doctor could recommend anything for the pain. Was told if I wanted to talk to someone I should book a session even thought I just wanted a word of advice. Recepcionist told me to contact during emergency booking time that was at 9 am.
Next day I called at 9 am and was told the emergency appointement hour was at 8 am, soo I had to deal with the pain, and they couldn't recommend what I should take to ease on the paint.
Next day I called. they were able to book an appoitement…. 5 days from that day. Now I would have to deal with all the pain for 5 days.
When I got there the doctor told me I was okay and nothing was wrong.

In a later date I went to to hospital and was told to contact my gp to recommend me a doctor. It's been over 4 months and I lost will to keep on asking for them to suggest someone to me.

My exprience with them has been terrible, and I am looking for a new gp that can at least respect their patients

title: Orthopaedic
body: i came to this hospital to see an orthopaedic surgeon on the 14th October 2019.he his very nice person and introduced himself on arrival.came for a scan on 5th November and was seen again on 2nd December.waiting for a date for surgery on my foot but not had good experience with operation aftercare so going to another hospital for surgery.

title: Fantastic service
body: Had to attend a and e due to severe pain in my hip. Seen by doctor within a hour and half. The doctor diagnosed my problem quickly but asked if I would mind letting a junior doctor look at me to which I agree. The junior doctor was very thorough and friendly. I was given medication and written notes on my diagnosis and treatment. Really cannot fault the department

title: Very speedy and helpful
body: Was seen in less than an hour with a time-critical problem, which needed medication quickly.  Very professional consultation with doctor and medication prescribed straight away. The receptionist who took my call was very sympathetic and efficient.  I've used the practice for over ten years and the standards now are better than ever.

title: Efficient medical team
body: In for Vaginal Hysterectomy, my age 78. Medical team caring and efficient, operation amazing, no pain during or after procedure. Discharged next morning, real problem caused by 4 hour wait for meds to take home, this needs to be speeded up. Catering staff unhelpful and unwilling with bad attitude for sick patients.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Strong Contender- Worst Surgery in Walsall
body:
This Medical Practice is out there to make sure it comes first for the ‘Worst Rated Surgery In Walsall’. The non existent service levels being providing to their patients, they will be soon be winning awards.

It is a matter of great concern, I wonder where all the government and tax payers funded money is being spent on. This surgery is being poorly managed and even the secretary’s require additional customer service training.

Over the past year, I have tried contacting this practice number of times to request an appointment to see my GP for an ongoing medical condition. Whenever you call to request an appointment, the secretary’s are unable to schedule this and advise booking telephone consultations which would be 3-5 days away which is not good enough.

As you can see by the reviews posted recently this is another one to the collection today. I can also guarantee you they will surely be more  reviews to come from the other patients who also feel let down by the practice manager who’s responsibility it is for the smooth running and being able to offer patients appointments in a timely manner.

title: Massive praise to the staff
body:
Apart from one old school midwife , every midwife or support worker was amazing and made my uncomfortable time so much better. Caring ,attentive and really treated me with respect and as a human not a number. I am so very grateful for all the care I received and would recommend the department in a heartbeat. Great communication and very clear about what care I was going to receive.I look forward to returning to bring my babies Into the world.

Also very clean but also homely, food was good especially breakfast choice. 

One small recommendation that could just make the experience slightly more relaxing but not a big deal.... Look at fixing the televisions, I was in 3 different rooms and not one worked ..... Not even a remote in sight. Not an issue if in for a few hours but for a few days started to feel little distraction from feeling unwell would have been great .

title: Great practice
body: Fantastic service, always able to either be seen or to speak with someone. Brilliant office staff, one in particular was wonderful, so empathic

author: IR
title: The treatment I received after a fall.
body:
Day 1:  
while out for my daily exercise I tripped while running and landed heavily, putting out both hands to break my fall. I knew immediately that I’d dislocated my left shoulder. Forty-plus years ago I had a Putti-Platt operation on my right shoulder so I knew what was in front of me. I walked a quarter of a mile home and my wife took me to A&E. This is where my report really begins.  
I was seen by the staff on duty within 5 minutes of registering. I was x-rayed where it was confirmed that part of the socket (glenoid lip) had broken so it wouldn’t be as straight forward as the last time. The shoulder was reset and placed in a sling to maintain stability. I was instructed not to remove the sling until I’d seen the specialist. I was back home after 4 hours of what I can only describe as excellent medical attention.  
Day 2:  
I was contacted by the hospital staff to go in for a CT scan on my shoulder. Being a public holiday I was in and out the hospital within 20 minutes.  
Day 3:  
This time I was contacted by one of the orthopedic doctors to say that my case merited surgery and that I was to report to the ward in a few days to be prepared for surgery.  
Day 5:  
All went well and I was admitted into a single room in the ward where I was given all the necessary preparations.  
Day 6:  
First thing in the morning I was seen by my surgeon who explained fully what lay ahead especially in comparison to my previous experiences. All other staff explained their role in my operation so the operation went ahead that afternoon.  
I was back in my room a bit later than planned but all had gone well and I had a reasonably good night’s rest.  
Day 7:  
Once again my surgeon came in and explained in great detail the procedure that had to be done to repair the damage suffered in the fall. All the other staff, Anaesthesia, Physiotherapy etc came in to check me out and I was discharged that afternoon.  
Day 8:  
I am a retired scientist who has always trained and kept fit so all the extra details given were much appreciated.  
All the staff that I came into contact with during my treatment, from the room cleaning lady right up to the surgeon were a credit to the NHS and Crosshouse Hospital in particular. I just cannot speak highly enough of my overall treatment but thanks to everyone I came in contact with and the ones in the background I never met.

title: Awful waiting times
body: My grandmother was taken to hospital in an ambulance to Frimley Park hospital... once getting there has not seen a doctor for over 6 hours and still waiting. She is 85, has serious dementia and was put on a bed and kept in the corridor. Not just her may I add, all the other patients too. My grandad (husband) is also in his 80’s and completely exhausted. The NHS does a lot of good but these waiting times are absolutely atrocious.

title: Poor care
body:
My mother was left in tears on 3 occasions.
On more than 3 occasions the consultants requests were not followed by staff nurses
Nurses left my mum in her own faeces!!
Nurses did not prescribe correct medication

title: Disrespectful staff/bullying
body: I've attended this hospital since 1992. I attended the Nephrology clinic from 1992-2012. From 2012-2014 I attended the low clearence clinic, and then in 2014 I received a kidney transplant and attended the transplant clinic. Up to 2014 I found the staff to be very friendly and polite, and the care received was brilliant. After my transplant, I began to attend the transplant clinic in 2014!. One of the senior nursing staff who was allocated to 'look after me' during the first week of attending this clinic, clearly took a dislike to me, and it didn't take too long before it filtered down to the other staff, one or two of them who even to this day treat me badly. I'm really not quite sure what to do; I dread attending this clinic, but it will now unfortunately be a life long ordeal. Visited again on 6th January 2020, and was again badly treated by one of the senior nursing staff.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: They hang up on you and leave on hold
body: Called the other day to speak to a doctor to get referred to hospital as I am disabled and need to see a specialist. They told me 'call tomorrow', then hung up. I called back, then put on hold for 10 minutes, before the call died. Registered a complaint, 4 days later, still no response from them. Disgraceful practice. It seems we are supposed to just die, as they don't help.

title: Fabulous service
body: I attended the Radiology department yesterday & was very impressed with the quality & efficiency of the department. I had to have three X-Rays & the total time from leaving my car to enter the hospital to arriving back at me car was 9 minutes. We can all be a bit quick to complain about a service we receive at GP surgery’s & hospitals, but I can only say the service I received from all the staff on the Radiology department yesterday was fabulous.

title: Excellent treatment,
body:
The paramedics were fantastic, Mum had head injury and we were rushed to the QA and treated initially very quickly ,however once assessed were left to wait an awful long time, but I suppose that’s how it is, the we’re equally apologetic and lovely
Well done the QA

title: blood test
body: There is a walk in blood test available of Fridays 0830 to 12.30 and also after lunch, it also some other days. This is a convenient excellent service for those of us who live in the Lichfield area; long may it continue. Others may wish to add other time this facility is available.

title: Worst reception staff - DO NOT COME HERE!
body: This is the worst GP practice I have ever been to. It is near impossible to get an appointment, the reception staff are supposed to be taking calls from 8am but when you ring it doesnt go through until 20past! There are very few on the day appointments so when they finally pick up the phone you cant get an appointment. They are rude and arrogant. When I finally got an appointment and was waiting for the doctor all the reception staff were having a gossip while the phones rang! Incredibly rude and I would recommend anyone thinking of this practice to go anywhere else other than here!

author: Jane D
title: Being able to stay at home for Christmas
body: I have COPD and Asthma so a cough can be a big problem for me. Having had a GP visit as I was struggling for breath she called Hospital at Home. Thanks to the wonderful Nurses and Doctors I was able to stay at home for Christmas. They came in each day to make sure I was making progress. They brought in Medication and a          a Nebuliser and made sure I understood what was going on. They were kind and caring and I am so very very grateful to them.

title: unable to contact
body: having received a review reply to my first email I was asked to contact a lady regarding the review , great news except there is no telephone number or email address to contact the lady concerned. as per my original email its is all about the lack or undeliverable communication promises , I have called main hospital reception this morning 10-1-20 AND GUESS WHAT AN ANSWER MACHINE.

title: greece
body: I come from Greece one year ago - gp help me a lot my family like doctors so I am very happy with gp

title: Good Practice and High standards
body:
I was seen initially at Cromer Hospital on Saturday 28th December following severe lacerations to my L hand following a fall whilst staying nearby, Seen by clinical staff I was then referred to the Plastic Surgery Dept. at the N & N hospital in Norwich.  On arrival seen straight away by a nurse then by the Senior Registrar. who proceeded to clean suture and dress my hand. with the  precision 
demonstrated by a well qualified plastic surgeon. I came aqay with a huge boxers glove dressing and an enormous  sling. 2 week later by sutures are now out and my hand is beginning to recover still some bruising, but I consider myself so lucky to be in the right place .that Saturday evening.   Thankyou .

title: Good doctor
body: Very happy to receive my tests for blood and nerve conduct very efficient and very quick acting the doctor offered me a phone consultation and talked me through my results he was very thorough and polite explaining all my symptoms and the diagnosis he also sent a prescription there and then to the pharmacy and emailed advice on both conditions which have been discovered explaining the treatment of the conditions and how they affect you’re health

title: Great service
body: We had an excellent service with a welcoming reception and brilliant doctors.

title: Really happy with the service
body: I have been with the surgery for 10 years now, I chose it as it was a modern multi service health centre for me and my family. The surgery had issues in the past but service and reception is now very much improved, staff are very helpful and patient.

title: They do their outmost to avoid seeing/talking to…
body:
Called and booked a triage call (this is their first wall against seeing patients and have been misdiagnosed over the phone a few times already because of the superficiality of such practice). 

The call never came. 

They insist they call twice. 

There is no trace of these call on my phone. There should be either of the following: 

1. Missed calls. 
2. Voicemails. 
3. A text from the carrier notifying that someone tried to call whilst the number was unreachable (e.g. no signal, etc.)

It is unlikely that someone tries your number twice, and none of the above happens. 

Also, the practice is questionable. The doctors should count as attempted calls only those ones that *ring* but there is no answer to. 

If they also want to count the number of times the number was unreachable, they should count this separately and have a higher threshold. For example, "I tried 4 times over 4 hours, so the  patient is definitely unreachable". 

In conclusion, just yet another barrier, that together with others, had made this practice totally detached from reality and on average useless to the average person with a flu or other non-threatening symptoms. 

They have far too many patients and they are clearly unable to fulfil their duties.

title: Conflicting advice
body: At my last diabetic retina scan (17 Dec) I was told off for not having annual eye tests. When I tried to make an appointment at Specsavers, I was told the NHS would not pay for the test as I am on a 2 year recall. WHO IS RIGHT!!!

title: Good service
body: Own doctor referred me to Polyclinic. Had appointment within a week. Got there and seen almost immediately. Both doctor and health worker were pleasant and explained everything well. No bad comments to make all.

author: Stumpywop
title: Different caliber of nursing staff
body:
My Dad has always been stubborn but at the turn of the year, he was taken by ambulance to Hospital.  
He was assessed in A&E, ultimately being moved to the ICU shortly afterward.  
My Dad had sepsis which unfortunately became septic shock, with ridiculously low blood pressure and complete kidney failure.  
My Brother and I made the heartbreaking decision to withdraw medical intervention and make him comfortable until the end.  
The staff at the ICU are amazing. I cannot fault them in any way. There is one nurse to each patient and they are so very kind. I would have to say they're a different "calibre" of nursing staff.  
For how they treated my Dad, my family who had to say goodbye and myself I must say "thank you", but it doesn't seem enough.  
So, Thank you, Thank you, Thank you......

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Care
body:
I would just like to say a very big thank you to my Consultant and all the team who looked after me when I had a triple bypass in April this year.

Most of the staff were truly amazing and always had time to talk and reassure.

I would love to see you all again but NOT as an impatient!

Many thanks again.

Jill

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: EPU
body: Disgusting wait time over 5 hours and no one tells you this at the beginning. Having to sit on these uncomfortable chairs for this long is just wrong.

title: Would highly recommend.
body: Went in to have my baby. I was nervous because I had to be induced but the staff made me feel so comfortable. When it was time to have my baby they couldn’t have been more attentive. We had a few problems and they kept me so calm through it all. Also after I had her I had to stay in 2 days and the staff helped me so much, I couldn’t have asked for more.

title: Great Practice
body: Efficient and friendly receptionist and the GP took time and care understanding my concerns and helping me

title: Receptionist
body:
Yesterday I was called to my daughters school by the matron because my daughter had a high heart rate and shaking hands. She is 12 years old.
Matron had spoken to 111 and the advice was if it stayed elevated for another 30 minutes then we should see the GP within the next hour.  Her heart rate was checked and it remained high so I rang the surgery  for an appointment only for the receptionist to say " Oh 111 always say see your GP "  She decided I would be put on the list for a call back from the doctor. I found this very stressful being given advice by 111 then the non medically trained reception telling me this advice was incorrect and I would have to wait for a call without any idea how long that would be.
As it turned out my daughters heart rate eventually came down after a reaction to her asthma drugs but what if as 111 had advised she had needed to see a doctor within the hour ???????????

title: Disappointing
body: On the 30th December I had an appointment to visit a particular nurse, but my grandfather was unwell I had been visiting the previous day. I went an email saying I wouldn't be able to. Attend via c82071@nhs.net  as the text message instructions. Normally ib would phone but in had no signal on the French train , which had broken down I emailed but they never got and I got a. Letter saying I missed the appointment  I emailed with 4 hours notice poor at communication

title: very helpful clinic
body:
I recently received Physiotherapy treatment at this practice ,
and i must say thank you to all the staff for the help and support,
the exercises i have been given from your staff have helped me a lot.
keep up the good work.

author: coinrj87
title: A great programme
body:
Sleep tight has helped us sort our our son's sleep pattern.  
Before coming for the course, our son barely slept through the night and always woke up to sing and play at around 1am-2am.  
During sleep tight, we've learned about sleep cycle, how to settle a child and also how to help them stay in bed when they wake up during the night.  
Sleep tight is a great programme that has allowed parents to share information and discuss how to address issues and methods to use to solve problems.  
Emma and Cilla have been a great help and very encouraging.  
Thank you

title: Friendly & efficient
body: I attended Hainault Ultrasound clinic. Although early, they accommodated me. Receptionist, nurse and radiologist friendly and reassuring

title: Disappointed
body: Always rude staff on reception at both surgery locations, abrupt and uncaring and very unhelpful. There is no compassion. Even the Drs I've seen seem like they don't want to be there and your 10 mins with them is a chore. They don't explain procedures, tests or why you're having them at all. And I don't expect a Dr to smirk when you're speaking about your depression low mood and medication. And why am I being asked if they should remove a medication from my repeat prescription why they have advised I take it surely the Dr should be asking themselves this question not me!? Never known anything like it. What happened to giving a damn about patients and not making them feel like they're a nuisance

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: So impressed
body: I had an operation on my shoulder on New Year's Eve – which was absolutely fine with so many cheerful and efficient people taking care of me. At home the next day – a bank holiday – I had a query about the discharge notes and, on the off chance, telephoned the only number I had – for Boddington ward, where I came round from the operation. I was answered in seconds and the helpful respondent was able to answer my question immediately after checking records online. People sometimes complain that it can be hard to get through to a hospital or other NHS service. This was a great example of easy and effective communication. Thank you.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Quick response
body: I've used the online service twice this week for 2 different problems.. I have contact within an hour really didnt think I would like it and I hate change but it's good!

title: Poor Communication
body: I was advised to make a follow up appointment with Southend Hospital for a repeat blood test. I wasn't told that I had to go into the surgery to pick up paperwork and as I'm unable to get into the surgery before my appointment I've had to cancel it. I did call the surgery and ask them to email the forms but they refused as I don't have an NHS email address. When I asked why I wasn't advised to come in and pick up a form for this beforehand I was told that this is the procedure and that "that's how it is". Never having had a repeat blood test before, I'm not sure how I'm supposed to know what to do and am disappointed with the lack of service and advice I have received regarding this matter.

author: horologiumez45
title: It is good for my family routine
body:
I was struggling a lot with my sons sleeping, as he woke up every night 3 to 4 times for milk or just woke up and starts crying and needs me to pick him up. I feel so exhausted the next day, had no full night sleep since he was born. Then I decided to attend the sleeping programme. I came to know about this programme at Sure Start as I attend the stay and play class every week. I start coming to this programme with Emma & Cilla running it and I can say this is the best programme I have attended and right decision I have made. I get the chance to speak about all the issues I am going through with my sons sleeping, discuss it with other parents, listen to their opinions and issues and have learned so many new things of what I can do and what could be changed with the sleeping routine and even the daytime routine. I have made these changes to his sleeping routine and I can say now he's asleep by 10:00 pm, latest 10:30 pm every night. Its late but it is good for my family routine as his dad comes home after 9 pm and he wants to see him before he goes to sleep. So, I am more confident emotionally, and mentally. All thanks to Emma and Cilla and all the parents for all the help and support.  
Thank you xx

title: Great Practice
body: I suspected a fracture, but as I live near Darenth Hospital knowing A & E can be very busy.  I rang Gravesend Minor Injury Unit and the lady in a very welcoming tone recommended I go there. On arrival I didn’t have to wait more than 10 minutes and I was examined by a lovely nurse, who took down all my details and recommended an x-ray.  I was then taken through by a very cheerful male nurse, who examined my foot and comforted me that the swelling etc could be an over stretched ligament.  I was sent to be x-ray, within 5 minutes x-ray complete, I returned back to the cubicle and in great detail shown the x-ray be another male nurse.  I’d had other fractures that I hadn’t realised but a ligament had been the problem this time.  We were very impressed by the professional attitude and how informative the staff were, happy to answer any questions and kept me laughing to take my mind off the pain, they both were very cheerful and giving me much welcomed advice on improving my exercise routine to strengthening weights which I hadn’t thought of before at my age (54).  We had a very engaging chat on how I could improve my health and suggestions on exercise and to change my diet, as needing to after the Christmas greediness, as the x-ray showed a possibility of osteoporosis.  So thank you very much.  For A brilliant service, for treating me with much care and respect, very quickly and thoroughly.  And for answering all my questions and giving me great advice.  You do a great job.  Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Due to my medical condition i was grateful that free parking close to the unit was available. The reception staff were very helpful and  i was seen promptly. The two medical staff that dealt with me were courteous and helpful throughout and made the whole procedure relaxed and efficient. I was kept informed about how the procedure would be undertaken and next steps. This was a well run effective facility that made me feel comfortable and informed throughout despite obvious pressures NHS staff are under these days. Well done!

title: Excellent cataract care
body:
The staff and surgeon were kind and did a very good job of explaining things along the way in connection with my cataract surgery. They happily took the time and trouble to work out the correct lens to give me near-vision in the eye in question, coordinating it with the distance-vision in my other eye (operated on 5 years ago) so as to continue the monovision that has worked well for me for some time. Best of all, my resulting vision is outstanding. 

I have no connection to the NHS except as a patient, but I believe it deserves more credit for the many times, like this one, that it works so very well -- primarily due to its dedicated personnel.  Thanks to all!

readBy.name: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service
body:
I have had chronic pain for years and for 8 of these College Street doctors have all diagnosed me with nerve damage which after finally getting referred to the pain management clinic in Nottingham was told it was muscle damage and that because nothing had been done that this has simply made my pain 100 time worse. I also must add it took me to tell the Dr that I was suicidal for them to finally do something. 
Fast forward until 2019 I needed higher pain management medication because other options for anything have never been explored. I have now been prescribed morphine, the liquid when needed and the slow release. When I take the morphine (as I'm prescribed to do) and then need to request more, this request has had a 100% decline rate meaning that a medication review is needed. After going to each appointment I am then given the pain relief I need and then have to do the same thing every month. 
I completely understand that the Drs need to ensure that the medication is being taken with care and in the proper way, however I still have to waste everyone's time by taking an appointment away from someone that actually needs and wants the appointment. 
I have now taken to decision to move practices because there is only so much one person can take when it comes to awful non-caring service. 
The situation I find myself in every month is making my depression so much worse, because not only am I having to worry about not getting what I need to be able to function and work but I then have to take time out of work in which means I do not get paid which then adds stress and anxiety on top of everything else. 
The fact that this practice has been very happy to simply throw drugs at the problem for 10 years and now because the Govt have said that there is a problem with Drs prescribing too many opiates, I have to jump through hoops to get the medication that allows me to get out of bed in the morning and work full time so I am not relying on other people and benefits. 

Not only does this cause stress, anxiety and makes depression worse, this is extremely unhelpful and worrying that this has to happen now when I am in this position due to being misdiagnosed for so long and by having medication given to me left, right and centre.

title: Don't bother for urgent care
body:
If you need a blood test or have a planned appointment then maybe it's ok but for Urgent care Don't Bother.

We had an hour and a half wait to be told that my wife needed an Xray and to go to Frimley Hospital.
When I said you do Xrays here, they said you have to have a letter from your doctor, So you need to go to Frimley.
She had an accident why would we have a letter from the doctor.
Total waste of time for urgent care.

When we got to the Hospital they said the Xray could have been done at the Healthspace Brants Bridge and that they were sick of Brants Bridge passing patients 
to them that could have been treated there but weren't, just to make there figures look good.

title: Excellent Hospital
body: I was bought into AE on 05/01/20 then moved to AAU and then MSSU ward the help and care I have received was amazing a big thank you. I must add the was great as well

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Nurses
body: Friendly nurses and reception staffs.  They handle great pressure of patients yet they respond in a friendly way.

title: Operation to fuse bones
body: I had operation 0n 24th August 2019 and had a very bad experience with getting low oxygen levels if it wasn't for the amazing staff I would not be here today I an very grateful to all staff and doctors concerned

title: unsatisfactory waiting time
body:
we had an appointment today that was booked a few weeks back for a time that suited me to get time of work. only for the appointment to be delayed 50 minutes, it was not possible trying to ask the receptionist why, because the poor lady had about 20 people queueing up and was at the desk alone. i feel the surgery is letting its clients down as well as own staff and should have at least two receptionists at the desk all of the time. or when it becomes busy a buzzer to get one of the staff from the office to come and help 
also rather than having loads of people queueing up standing for long times and blocking the walkways. why not introduce a ticket system same as when you go to the hospital for a blood test. that way people can take a ticket and sit down until their number flashes up. 

thanks 
andy

title: Great doctors, front desk staff less so
body:
While I always have had good experiences with the doctors here, the administrative staff are often brusque - which I don't mind generally, they're busy and I get that; but four times running now they have failed to respond to requests for repeat prescriptions from my chemist and then said they never received it - each time I've watched my chemist both email and fax the request over.

There have been two instances where I've heard reception staff speaking quite derisively about patients they've been on the phone with moments earlier too, loud enough for everyone in the waiting room to hear.

title: A good practice
body:
My family and I have been patients of Three Villages since the 1970s when it was based at Audnam Lodge and in general I have always found it to be a good practice.
I understand the frustration of not being able to get an appointment easily sometimes but I also understand there are only so many available each day and find Patient Access is good for any cancellations and normally where I manage to book.
The extended hours service is fabulous and I find the Doctors and Reception team very helpful.
Thankyou Three Villages,you all do a great job and probably don't get enough people telling you this.

title: Excellent A & E Department
body: I spent a day in the A and E Department at Scarborough Hospital last Sunday investigating possible heart problems and would like to thank everyone in the department for their kindness, care and consideration.  It is obvious to see that in many ways the staff in A and E have to work under circumstances which are far from ideal.  Yet their professionalism, good humour and genuine care for their patients all shone through during the day.  I am very grateful and, in my opinion, think that Scarborough Hospital has an A and E Department of which it can be proud.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: handsetpd38
title: Care
body:
I had provided with good care  
the staff are caring and attentions  
![Image](https://www.careopinion.org.uk/resources/posting-images/opinions/6c3b3e4999d747079b51ad9a769ba138.png)

title: Great experience
body: Have been attending this dept for a back issue. Whilst there mentioned to one particular staff member that I had a what I believed was a vertigo issue. This staff member sorted it with a simple few movements. Can’t thank him enough. I feel absolutely great. Can’t wait for next appointment. Jacqui Wilson

title: Helpful IBD Nurse
body: I have just had an appointment in the IBD Clinic today.  My appointment was with a male nurse.  He was so kind, helpful and knowledgable.  Feel so much better after speaking to him.  Thank you.

title: Fantastic care
body:
Simply 5 star treatment. Excellent Oncologist team Highly recommended department 
It is a delightful place to visit.  This department is fully equipped with very caring team of Oncologists.

author: BucksGuy473612
title: Came in for Support & left feeling I'm being kicked out
body:
I came in to One Recovery to get support and to talk with someone. I spoke with a staff member, and told them that I had a bad time in December, and nearly killed myself. Instead of being supportive, I felt they put excessive pressure on me to join Structured Treatment, and then ask me to justify why I came to the service. I felt like they were kicking my crutches away, and threatening to remove the limited support One Recovery offers.  
This is the second time after speaking with this particular staff member where I left the service in tears. I feel this staff member really doesn't have any understanding of how to speak to people with depression. I feel like they are confusing support, with berating someone for not making the choices they want them to.  
I do need to come in and talk with someone, but I don't feel safe talking with this member of staff any more, so I will need to be assigned to someone else. And I also need contacting to let me know if One Recovery is an open access service that offers needle exchange and brief interventions to everyone, or if there is some other requirement for using needle exchange that I'm not aware of.

title: Poor
body:
I spoke to a doctor about how I’ve been feeling last night, when I went into see them for another issue. Initially felt like I was actually getting help as had a call from a lovely lady in the Crisis Team at Grantham within 2 hours. She arranged an appointment for me to go in at 6pm on Monday. 
Lady called today to cancel the appointment and no real effort made to help. When I said it was fine forget it she went okay. Reaching out was hard, and now I’m back to square one. Lesson learned, there is no help out there, and the world really is as awful a place as I believe.
Shouldn’t have bothered

title: One size fits all
body:
Waited a while for my first appointment which is fine I understand waiting lists etc 
I’d stated in my application that my issues are from my past and I feel I’m suffering from CPTSD and I’d like to figure out where my issues came from and tackle them that way, was told that’s exactly what would happen. 
Went to my first appointment and told her about my issues in childhood and she told me that she would use these sessions to build a case to refer me to adult mental health and that she will not use these sessions to talk about my past at all and she would use these sessions to tackle day to day things which I’d stated weren’t my issue. 
The next few sessions were few and far between and seemed she used the 45 minute session to kind of talk at me and read off of sheets about ways of thinking, I felt I would hardy talk in the sessions and if I ever brought up a reason I thought something happened she would shut me down and tell me that it’s not what we should be talking about as it was immoral to ‘open the box’ which like I said was what I was there to do in the first place. She also sometimes made me feel quite silly for doing some things I do day to day and things that I worried about that I’d wrote in the ‘feelings diary’ she asked me to write. 
It felt like she was reading a script and from other reviews and comments it seems others have had the same experience. 
If your issues are just day to day things then maybe this would work for you but it’s not counselling in the sense that you will leave feeling like you’ve opened up and understood WHY you might have said issues. 
In conclusion I probably wouldn’t access this service again nor recommend it to anyone that I feel is suffering from real issues, I feel like I’ve wasted my time and not gotten any further with my mental health and will have to continue to look for alternatives. 
That all being said the counsellor I saw was lovely and I’m not blaming her as I’m sure she’s just following procedure of the practice.

title: A & E on Christmas Day
body: Brilliant care on Christmas Day. I went to A & E on Christmas Day which no one wants to do but I'm sure they don't really want to be working either. However staff were so happy and helpful and I was in and out within an hour. Thank you so much!

title: Fantastic practice
body: I rang up Whitegate Drive centre in December on a Sunday for my Mum, who has Alzheimer's , I knew she had a urine infection just from previous experience, when I arrived I was told to go in straight away as my Mum was quite distressed, i saw a doctor who straight away confirmed my Mum's infection and gave me antibiotics. The Doctor was so kind, professional ( some doctors really are not ) and was so lovely to my Mum, as some doctors don't acknowledge her .I told the receptionist how lovely he was as i suppose not many people give them much feedback. I have been to Whitegate drive  quite a few times now with Grandchildren and Mum, and I have to say it is absolutely fabulous and I really can't fault the whole place. Also it is immaculately clean too. ( cleaners never get any thanks either )

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: excellence in A&E
body: I should like to record my deep appreciation of the efforts of the staff of the A&E Unit,and initially those in the Recuperative Stroke Unit ( Ward E-1) who looked after me on the afternoon of 7th January 2020. I could not have wished for more attentive, concerned and professional treatment. Fortunately my medical issues proved not to be all that serious or incapacitating but I am very grateful for the reassurance given and the evident skills and speedy medical advice provided. My experience confirmed my faith in the NHS as an institution and provided a great illustration of the high standards achieved at Stepping Hill. I hope that these comments find their way to the individuals/units concerned.

title: Appalling service
body: When I last visited the practice with my daughter who has learning difficulties I was told to call and get an appointment with the next flare up however I was told that the duty doctor has said that I would need to go to A&E if I wanted to be seen that day. When I asked for the doctors name and gphc number the receptionist hadn’t got a clue. I think this is an absolute joke and poor example for the NHS team.

title: never had a problem
body: we always pop down just before 8am and manage to get a same day appointment - which by today's standards I think is exceptional

title: waste of time
body: what is the point in having a doctors surgery if you cant get an appointment? Call and its an automated call service and says everyday that there is no appointments and hangs up. When i do get through to the reception they are no help at all, she explained that i cant get an appointment for any time next week as they dont do appointments like that anymore, i have to call back tomorrow and because it will be the friday i wont hear anything until monday. So i have called back today and actually got through to someone but i now have to wait for the doctor to call me and then he will let me know if he needs to see me or not and bearing in mind that will be on wednesday and it is friday so i have to wait 4 days to see if the doctor will even see me. She explained  that this is the way that they do it now. Very unprofessional and a joke of a doctors. WASTE OF TIME

title: Most professional hospital service I have ever…
body:
I honestly can not thank the staff enough. From the reception team, optometrist, technicians, nurses and surgeon I have never felt so fortunate to be looked after by such a caring bunch of people. SpaMedica should be proud of all the staff. 
I was so frightened, my hand was held through the surgery which kept me comfortable and calm. I had my second eye done yesterday and the results are fantastic. To all the staff thank you from the bottom of my heart for looking after me, I really could not have gone through the operation without the care I received.

title: Awful experience
body: Reception staff including manager, disgracefully rude. Can see why the reception talk to patients wth such disrespect after experiencing first hand how their manager behaves. Doctors are fantastic. Reception are absolutely appalling!

title: Constructive criticism
body: As a patient of the student Restorative team, despite some suggesting a risky activity?I have only very positive feedback.The care and "VIP" treatment super.However,as students are learning their craft,i feel obliged to offer some constructive criticisms.My intention isnt to get any individuals into trouble,far from it,but maybe a general word of warning?During moments waiting for a supervisor,or other gaps in proceedure,some of the "idel chat"about the course,other fellow students,missing lectures,etc,to my mind shouldnt be aired in front of patients.Working well with your assistant,and not being tounge tide and setting a relax atmosphere,i understand,cool.Maybe worth reminding all students,of all years,try to stay "on duty at all times".Again i hope this isnt directed to any individuals,but i was able to over hear,the suggestion,any private dental practice,would have superior aquiptment,to any NHS set up.And for me,more concerning,during another idel chat,that a supervisors advice was "lacking?"was it a woman?that will be why!To be honest,i have recently lost alot of my trust in UK polotics,and am super concerned about about our natioal treasure the NHS being broken ever harder.As a student teacher,back in the day,i understand,having challenges/cricisms with the system.But its made me feel uncomfortable,that only on this out of the norm occasion,these students didnt seem greatful,for their great opportunity to be learning,in the greatest place on the planet,to learn.Sorry rant over.I have every faith ,both these yougsters will grow into super good Dentists,and in my humble way,hope i have helped them on their way.These short years ,will be passed before you know it,you are in such a special,privalaged place,good luck,respect to you all.Sorry for moan,but i feel better for my words of warning,take care.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

author: Redlondoner
title: Just wanted to say 'Thank you'
body: I had an appointment with DR ABIGAIL on the 9th of January. She was so nice and kind. I just want to say thank you for her. She is very helpful and friendly. Thank you very much Dr Abigail.

author: LMNO
title: Mental Health Stigma... even by the lead clinicians
body:
The clinical lead of crisis services spoke very rudely to me when I was in a very dark place and not feeling strong enough to stand up for myself. I expressed I was suicidal... and they said they did not believe me... told me I was just trying to get help.  
I shut down at this point as I knew my resources had been cut off.  
It is widely understood that a BPD diagnosis evokes a lot of stigma, also from clinicians are they do not yet understood how to treat it. However it is been responded to by discharging patients and labelling them as help-seekers, just as the clinical lead of the crisis team did.  
Afterwards I felt unable to even access crisis support as this nurse had just written that I am not suicidal on my notes. How could I access help after that... and so I took all the medicine I had. I have no memory after that of what happened. I woke up in hospital and walked away once I had physical strength again.  
I feel that the crisis team and mental health service in York are in need of change. People are being neglected, ignored, pushed away and given labels that don't belong to them.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust
